intro: Coffea antsingyensis, commonly known as the Madagascar coffee plant, is a species native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and white flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain two seeds, which are used to make coffee. It thrives in tropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
